p: Total phenolic content, particularly flavonoids (TFC) with potential antioxidant activities, are extremely beneficial to consumers. These components can deactivate free radicals in plants, which may be caused by hydroxyl groups [ 45]. Ripening of the fruits throughout the storage could be the main reason for the increase in flavonoids in the present work [ 21]. The control samples displayed a lower content of flavonoids than the coated samples. The types of fruits, as well as composition index, could affect the amount of flavonoids [ 45].
